intro: Peristylus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered peristylus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, bloom in late spring or early summer. Peristylus fasciculatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
